Question.Text: A 45-year-old man presents to a clinic in Malawi with back pain and progressive difficulty in walking. He denies any constitutional symptoms.

Answer: Spinal tuberculosis (Pott's disease) - The patient presents with back pain and progressive neurological symptoms (difficulty walking) without fever in Malawi, a TB-endemic region. The images show vertebral body destruction with collapse and kyphotic deformity on spinal imaging, and acid-fast bacilli (Mycobacterium tuberculosis) on microscopy, characteristic of skeletal tuberculosis affecting the spine.
